parseschema.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* MathML Schema parser and C++ code generator.
00002  *
00003  * (c) Jos van den Oever 2003
00004  *
00005  * This program reads the MathML Schema specification for the MathML 2.0
00006  * It has been tested with the 2002 Schema verions by St&#233;phane Dalmas.
00007  *
00008  * Purpose:
00009  * To generate C++ code that describes
00010  * 1 which elements may contain which attributes
00011  * 2 contains partial information on how to parse each attribute
00012  *
00013  */
00014 
00015 #include <QFile>
00016 #include <QFileInfo>
00017 #include <QDomElement>
00018 #include <QDomNode>
00019 #include <QTextStream>
00020 #include <QDir>
00021 #include <iostream>
00022 using std::endl;
00023 #include <fstream>
00024 using std::ifstream;
00025 using std::ofstream;
00026 #include <set>
00027 using std::set;
00028 #include <map>

00033 using std::string;

00036 
00037 struct attributeinfo {
00038         QString type;
00039         QString deflt;
00040 };
00041 
00042 struct elementinfo {
00043         QDomElement type;
00044         map<QString, attributeinfo> atts;
00045 };
00046 
00047 // After parsing the Schema, this map contains all the information from it,
00048 // that we need.
00049 map<QString, elementinfo> elements;
00050 
00051 // this list contains information from a file 'custattlist' that links
00052 // each attribute name to its type. Attributes with equal name but belonging
00053 // to different elements are assumed to have the same type. Any differentiation
00054 // has to programmed by hand
00055 map<QString, QString> custattlist;
00056 
00057 // to avoid a lot of similar error messages, we remember the attributes, we've
00058 // already complained about in this set
00059 set<QString> notfoundattribs;
00060 
00061 // convenient global variable with the dir where the schema files are
00062 QString dir;
00063 
00064 QTextStream out(stdout);
00065 QTextStream err(stderr);
00066 
00067 
00068 // debugging function that prints the attributes of an element
00069 void
00070 printAttributes(QDomElement e, uint level) {
00071         QDomNamedNodeMap m = e.attributes();
00072         for (uint i=0; i<m.length(); ++i) {
00073                 for (uint j=0; j<level; ++j) out << ' ';
00074                 QDomNode n = m.item(i);
00075                 out << "+"<<n.nodeName() << ": "
00076                         << n.nodeValue() << endl;
00077         }
00078 }
00079 // debugging function that visualises the xml structure
00080 void
00081 printNode(QDomNode n, uint level) {
00082         while (!n.isNull()) {
00083                 for (uint i=0; i<level; ++i) out << ' ';
00084                 out << n.nodeName() << endl;
00085                 if (n.isElement()) {
00086                         QDomElement e = n.toElement();
00087                         printAttributes(e, level+2);
00088                 }
00089                 if (n.hasChildNodes()) {
00090                         printNode(n.firstChild(), level+1);
00091                 }
00092                 n = n.nextSibling();
00093         }
00094 }
00095 // function that loads an XML document into a QDomDocument object
00096 QDomDocument
00097 loadDocument(QString p) {
00098         QFile f(p);
00099         f.open(QIODevice::ReadOnly);
00100         QDomDocument d;
00101         QString err;
00102         d.setContent(&f, true);
00103         return d;
00104 }
00105 // function that parses an XML DOM for 'xs:include' directives and loads
00106 // and inserts the mentioned documents into it
00107 void
00108 load(QDomNode n) {
00109         while (!n.isNull()) {
00110                 if (n.hasChildNodes()) {
00111                         load(n.firstChild());
00112                 }
00113                 if (n.nodeName() == "xs:include") {
00114                         QString f = n.toElement().attribute("schemaLocation");
00115                         QDomDocument d = loadDocument(dir+"/"+f);
00116                         QDomDocument o = n.ownerDocument();
00117                         QDomNode newn = o.importNode(d.documentElement(), true);
00118                         QDomNode p = n.parentNode();
00119                         QDomNode old = n;
00120                         n = n.nextSibling();
00121                         p.removeChild(old);
00122                         while (!newn.firstChild().isNull()) {
00123                                 p.insertBefore(newn.firstChild(), n);
00124                         }
00125                 } else {
00126                         n = n.nextSibling();
00127                 }
00128         }
00129 }
00130 // function that looks for an XML element with the attribute 'name' that has
00131 // the wanted value. When the element is found it is copied into argument 't'
00132 // and the rest of the tree is parsed. When more elements with the name
00133 // are found an error is reported
00134 void
00135 findTypeElement(QString type, QDomNode n, QDomElement &t) {
00136         while (!n.isNull()) {
00137                 if (n.toElement().attribute("name") == type) {
00138                         if (t.isNull()) {
00139                                 t = n.toElement();
00140                         } else {
00141                                 err << "Hmm, there are more elements with"
00142                                         << "name=\"" << type << "\"." << endl;
00143                         }
00144                 }
00145                 if (n.hasChildNodes()) {
00146                         findTypeElement(type, n.firstChild(), t);
00147                 }
00148                 n = n.nextSibling();
00149         }
00150 }
00151 // in Schema, the 'type' attribute can be more complicated than a single string
00152 // This functions harvests this more complicated information by concatenating
00153 // all relevant strings describing the type.
00154 QString
00155 makeType(QDomElement e) {
00156         QString type;
00157         if (e.tagName() != "simpleType") {
00158                 err << "not a simple type!!" << endl;
00159         } else {
00160                 QDomNode n = e.firstChild();
00161                 e = n.toElement();
00162                 if (e.isNull()) {
00163                         err << "Hmm, this simpleType is empty." << endl;
00164                 }
00165                 if (e.tagName() == "union") {
00166                         type = e.attribute("memberTypes");
00167                 } else {
00168                         if (e.tagName() != "restriction") {
00169                                 err << "Hmm, I expected a restriction element."
00170                                         << endl;
00171                         }
00172                         QDomNode tn = e.firstChild();
00173                         while (!tn.isNull()) {
00174                                 if (tn.isElement()) {
00175                                         if (type != "") {
00176                                                 type += " | ";
00177                                         }
00178                                         type += tn.toElement().attribute("value");
00179                                 }
00180                                 tn = tn.nextSibling();
00181                         }
00182                 }
00183                 if (!n.nextSibling().isNull()) {
00184                         err << "Hmm, I expected only one child. Info might be"
00185                                 << " lost." << endl;
00186                 }
00187         }
00188         return type;
00189 }
00190 // function that tries to extract a type from an 'attribute' element
00191 // either the elements defines the type itself, or it is defined elsewhere
00192 // in that case, the attribute 'ref' points to the node containing the
00193 // definition
00194 QDomElement
00195 findAttElement(QDomElement e) {
00196         QDomNode d = e.ownerDocument().documentElement();
00197         QString ref = e.attribute("ref");
00198         QDomElement t;
00199         if (ref.isNull()) {
00200                 // the element has no ref attribute: we scan it's children
00201                 t = e;
00202                 QString type = makeType(e.firstChild().toElement());
00203                 if (type.isNull()) {
00204                         err << "did not find a type" << endl;
00205                 }
00206                 t.setAttribute("type", type);
00207         } else {
00208                 findTypeElement(ref, d, t);
00209                 if (t.isNull()) {
00210                         if (notfoundattribs.find("name") ==
00211                                         notfoundattribs.end()) {
00212                                 err << "Hmm, no element with name '" << ref
00213                                         << "' was found." << endl;
00214                                 notfoundattribs.insert("name");
00215                         }
00216                         t = e;
00217                         t.setAttribute("name", ref);
00218                 }
00219         }
00220         return t;
00221 }
00222 // recursive function that scans the DOM for attribute tags and stores their
00223 // name, type and default value in a global variable
00224 void
00225 collectAttributes(QDomNode n, map<QString, attributeinfo> &l) {
00226         while (!n.isNull()) {
00227                 if (n.isElement()
00228                         && n.toElement().tagName() == "attributeGroup") {
00229                         QString name = n.toElement().attribute("ref");
00230                         if (name.isNull()) {
00231                                 err << "Hmm, this group has a ref without a "
00232                                         << "defined element." << endl;
00233                         }
00234                         QDomElement g;
00235                         findTypeElement(name,
00236                                 n.ownerDocument().documentElement(), g);
00237                         if (g.isNull()) {
00238                                 err << "Hmm, no element with name=\""
00239                                         <<name<<"\" was found." << endl;
00240                         }
00241                         collectAttributes(g.firstChild(), l);
00242                 } else if (n.toElement().tagName() == "attribute") {
00243                         QDomElement e = n.toElement();
00244                         QString type = e.attribute("type");
00245                         if (type.isNull()) {
00246                                 e = findAttElement(e);
00247                                 type = e.attribute("type");
00248                         }
00249                         QString name = e.attribute("name");
00250                         pair<QString, attributeinfo> ai;
00251                         ai.first = name;
00252                         ai.second.type = type;
00253                         ai.second.deflt = e.attribute("default");
00254                         if (name.isNull()) {
00255                                 err << "grr. still no name or type" << endl;
00256                         }
00257                         l.insert(ai);
00258                 }
00259                 n = n.nextSibling();
00260         }
00261 }
00262 // function that scans the DOM for all 'attribute' elements
00263 void
00264 findAttributeElements(QDomElement e) {
00265         // in the mathml spec, e never has children
00266         if (!e.firstChild().isNull()) {
00267                 err << "Hmm, I did not expect childeren." << endl;
00268         }
00269         // check that there are only two attributes: name and type
00270         if (e.attributes().length() != 2 || !e.hasAttribute("type")) {
00271                 err << "Hmm, I expected two children for element elements."
00272                         << endl;
00273         }
00274         QString type = e.attribute("type");
00275         // find the element with the name type
00276         QDomElement typee;
00277         findTypeElement(type, e.ownerDocument().documentElement(),
00278                         typee);
00279         if (typee.isNull()) {
00280                 err << "Hmm, no element with name=\""<<type<<"\" was found."
00281                         << endl;
00282         }
00283         elements[e.attribute("name")].type = typee;
00284         collectAttributes(typee.firstChild(),
00285                         elements[e.attribute("name")].atts);
00286         //pmrintAttributes(e, 10);
00287 }
00288 // function that scans the DOM for all 'element' elements.
00289 void
00290 findElements(QDomDocument d) {
00291         QDomNodeList l = d.elementsByTagName("element");
00292         for (uint i=0; i<l.length(); ++i) {
00293                 QDomElement e = l.item(i).toElement();
00294                 if (e.hasAttribute("name")) {
00295                         findAttributeElements(e);
00296                 }
00297         }
00298 }
00299 #include <ios>
00300 // function for printing a list of all attribute types encountered in the Schema
00301 void
00302 printAttributeTypes() {
00303         set<QString> types;
00304         map<QString, elementinfo>::iterator i;
00305         for (i=elements.begin(); i!=elements.end(); ++i) {
00306                 map<QString, attributeinfo>::iterator j;
00307                 for (j=i->second.atts.begin(); j!=i->second.atts.end(); ++j) {
00308                         types.insert(j->second.type);
00309                 }
00310         }
00311         set<QString>::iterator s;
00312         out << "attribute list" << endl;
00313         for (s = types.begin(); s != types.end(); ++s) {
00314                 out << *s << endl;
00315         }
00316 }
00317 // function that prints a lines with an attribute name and its type
00318 void
00319 printAttributes() {
00320         multimap<QString, QString> atts;
00321         map<QString, elementinfo>::iterator i;
00322         // collect all data
00323         for (i=elements.begin(); i!=elements.end(); ++i) {
00324                 map<QString, attributeinfo>::iterator j;
00325                 for (j=i->second.atts.begin(); j!=i->second.atts.end(); ++j) {
00326                         atts.insert(pair<QString, QString>(j->first,
00327                                                 j->second.type));
00328                 }
00329         }
00330         // print the data
00331         multimap<QString, QString>::iterator s;
00332         for (s = atts.begin(); s != atts.end(); ++s) {
00333                 out << s->first << '\t' << s->second << endl;
00334         }
00335 }
00336 using std::ios_base;
00337 void
00338 printData() {
00339         map<QString, elementinfo>::iterator i;
00340         for (i=elements.begin(); i!=elements.end(); ++i) {
00341                 out << i->first << ":\n";
00342                 map<QString, attributeinfo>::iterator j;
00343                 for (j=i->second.atts.begin(); j!=i->second.atts.end(); ++j) {
00344                         out << "\t";
00345                         out.setFieldWidth(24);
00346                         out.setFieldAlignment(QTextStream::AlignLeft);
00347                         if (!j->first.isNull()) {
00348                                 out << j->first;
00349                         } else {
00350                                 out << "";
00351                         }
00352                         out.setFieldAlignment(QTextStream::AlignRight);
00353                         if (!j->second.type.isNull()) {
00354                                 out << j->second.type;
00355                         } else {
00356                                 out << "";
00357                         }
00358                         out.setFieldWidth(0);
00359                         if (!j->second.deflt.isNull()) {
00360                                 out << j->second.deflt;
00361                         } else {
00362                                 out << "";
00363                         }
00364                         out << endl;
00365                 }
00366         }
00367 }
00368 void
00369 printList(const QString &pre, const QString &post, list<QString> &l,
00370                 QTextStream &f) {
00371         f << "\t";
00372         list<QString>::const_iterator i;
00373         int left = 72;
00374         int d = 2 + pre.length() + post.length();
00375         for (i=l.begin(); i!=l.end(); ) {
00376                 int len = i->length() + d;
00377                 if (left < len) {
00378                         f << "\n\t";
00379                         left = 72;
00380                 }
00381                 f << pre << *i << post;
00382                 if (++i != l.end()) {
00383                         left -= len;
00384                         f << ", ";
00385                 }
00386         }
00387 }
00388 void
00389 printList(const QString &pre, const QString &post, set<QString> &s,
00390                 QTextStream &f) {
00391         set<QString>::const_iterator i;
00392         list<QString> l;
00393         for (i=s.begin(); i!=s.end(); ++i) {
00394                 l.push_back(*i);
00395         }
00396         printList(pre, post, l, f);
00397 }
00398 QString
00399 mkvar(const QString &s) {
00400         return s.toUpper().replace('-', '_').replace(':', '_');
00401 }
00402 void
00403 writeCode() {
00404         set<QString> el;
00405         set<QString> ucel;
00406         set<QString> at;
00407         list<QString> defat;
00408         set<QString> ucat;
00409         map<QString, set<QString> > ucelat;
00410         map<QString, elementinfo>::iterator i;
00411         set<QString> atty;
00412         list<QString> ucatty;
00413         set<QString> ucats;
00414         for (i=elements.begin(); i!=elements.end(); ++i) {
00415                 el.insert(i->first);
00416                 ucel.insert(mkvar(i->first));
00417                 QString elname = i->first;
00418                 elname.replace("-", "_");
00419                 set<QString> locelat;
00420                 map<QString, attributeinfo>::iterator j;
00421                 for (j=i->second.atts.begin(); j != i->second.atts.end(); ++j) {
00422                         at.insert(j->first);
00423                         ucat.insert(mkvar(j->first));
00424                         locelat.insert(mkvar(j->first));
00425                 }
00426                 ucelat.insert(pair<QString, set<QString> >(elname, locelat));
00427         }
00428         set<QString>::iterator l;
00429         for (l = at.begin(); l != at.end(); ++l) {
00430                 map<QString,QString>::iterator m = custattlist.find(*l);
00431                 if (m != custattlist.end()) {
00432                         atty.insert(m->second);
00433                         ucatty.push_back(mkvar(m->second));
00434                         ucats.insert(mkvar(m->second));
00435                 } else {
00436                         pair<QString, QString> p(*l, "DOMString");
00437                         custattlist.insert(p);
00438                         ucatty.push_back("DOMSTRING");
00439                         ucats.insert("DOMSTRING");
00440                 }
00441                 defat.push_back("");
00442         }
00443 
00444         // print to public mathml.h file (the one that will be exported)
00445         // (since i forgot this file's purpose, i'm commenting it out)
00446         //ofstream f;
00447 /*      f.open("elements.h");
00448         f << "// this file was automatically generated by 'parseschema'" << endl;
00449         f << "#ifndef ELEMENTS_H" << endl;
00450         f << "#define ELEMENTS_H" << endl;
00451         f << "namespace MML {" << endl;
00452         f << "enum Element {" << endl;
00453         printList("", "", ucel, f);
00454         f << "\n};" << endl;
00455         f << "const unsigned int numElements = " << el.size() << ";" << endl;
00456         f << "class Attributes;" << endl;
00457         f << "}" << endl;
00458         f << "#endif" << endl;
00459         f.close();*/
00460 
00461         // print to second, internal file: mathml.h
00462         //f.open("mathml.h");
00463         QFile file("mathml.h");
00464         file.open(QFile::WriteOnly  | QFile::Truncate);
00465         QTextStream f(&file);
00466         f << "// this file was automatically generated by 'parseschema'" << endl;
00467         f << "#ifndef MATHML_H" << endl;
00468         f << "#define MATHML_H" << endl;
00469         f << "typedef unsigned int uint;" << endl;
00470         f << "#include \"elements.h\"" << endl;
00471         f << "#include \"mathtypes.h\"" << endl;
00472         f << "namespace MML {" << endl;
00473 
00474         f << "enum AttributeType {" << endl;
00475         printList("", "_T", ucats, f);
00476         f << "\n};" << endl;
00477 
00478         f << "enum Attribute {" << endl;
00479         printList("", "", ucat, f);
00480         f << "\n};" << endl;
00481         f << "}" << endl;
00482 
00483         f << "class MMLAttribute {" << endl;
00484         f << "public:" << endl;
00485         f << "\tvirtual ~MMLAttribute() {}" << endl;
00486         f << "\tbool cleanup;" << endl;
00487 //      f << "\tvirtual MMLAttribute *copy() const = 0;" << endl;
00488         f << "};" << endl;
00489         for (l = atty.begin(); l != atty.end(); ++l) {
00490                 f << "class MML" << *l << " : public MMLAttribute {" << endl;
00491                 f << "public:" << endl;
00492                 f << "\tMML" << *l << "(" << *l << ", bool c=true);" << endl;
00493                 f << "\t" << *l << " value;" << endl;
00494 //              f << "\tMML" << *l << "*copy() const;" << endl;
00495                 f << "};" << endl;
00496         }
00497 
00498         f << "namespace MML {" << endl;
00499         map<QString, set<QString> >::iterator k;
00500         for (k = ucelat.begin(); k != ucelat.end(); ++k) {
00501                 f << "enum " << k->first << "Att {" << endl;
00502                 printList(k->first, "", k->second, f);
00503                 f << "\n};" << endl;
00504         }
00505         f << "const uint numAttTypes = " << ucats.size() << ";"<<endl;
00506         f << "const uint numAttributes = " << at.size() << ";" << endl;
00507         f << "extern const char * const elementTag[numElements];" << endl;
00508         f << "extern const Attribute * const attList[numElements];" << endl;
00509         f << "extern const uint attListLen[numElements];" << endl;
00510         f << "extern const char * const attributeTag[numAttributes];"<< endl;
00511         f << "extern const AttributeType attTypes["
00512                 << ucatty.size() << "];" << endl;
00513         for (k = ucelat.begin(); k != ucelat.end(); ++k) {
00514                 uint size = k->second.size();
00515                 f << "const uint " << k->first << "NumAtts = "
00516                         << size << ";" <<endl;
00517                 f << "extern const Attribute " << k->first << "Atts["
00518                         << (size ?size :1) << "];" << endl;
00519         }
00520         f << "int createAttribute(const char *, "
00521                 "const DOMString &value, Element e, const MMLAttribute **att);"
00522                 << endl;
00523         f << "int createAttribute(const Attribute, "
00524                 "const DOMString &value, Element e, const MMLAttribute **att);"
00525                 << endl;
00526         f << "MMLAttribute *createAttribute(const Attribute a, "
00527                 "const DOMString &value);" << endl;
00528         for (l = ucats.begin(); l != ucats.end(); ++l) {
00529                 f << "MMLAttribute *create" << *l
00530                         << "(const DOMString &, Attribute);" << endl;
00531         }
00532         f << "extern MMLAttribute * (* const attFunc[numAttTypes])("
00533                 "const DOMString &, Attribute);" << endl;
00534         f << "}" << endl;
00535         f << "#endif" << endl;
00536         f.flush();
00537         file.close();
00538 
00539         file.setFileName("mathml.cpp");
00540         file.open(QFile::WriteOnly  | QFile::Truncate);
00541         f.setDevice(&file);
00542         f << "// this file was automatically generated by 'parseschema'" << endl;
00543         f << "#include \"elements.h\"" << endl;
00544         f << "#include \"mathml.h\"" << endl;
00545         f << "using namespace MML;" << endl;
00546         for (l = atty.begin(); l != atty.end(); ++l) {
00547                 f << "MML" << *l << "::MML" << *l << "(" << *l
00548                         << " v, bool c)\n\t\t: value(v) {cleanup=c;\n}" << endl;
00549 //              f << "MML" << *l << " *" << endl;
00550 //              f << "MML" << *l << "::copy() const {" << endl;
00551 //              f << "\treturn new MML" << *l << "(value);" << endl;
00552 //              f << "}" << endl;
00553         }
00554         f << "const char * const MML::elementTag[" << el.size() << "] = {"<<endl;
00555         printList("\"", "\"", el, f);
00556         f << "\n};" << endl;
00557         f << "const char * const MML::attributeTag["<<at.size()<<"] = {" <<endl;
00558         printList("\"", "\"", at, f);
00559         f << "\n};" << endl;
00560         f << "const AttributeType MML::attTypes[" << at.size()
00561                 << "] = {"<<endl;
00562         printList("", "_T", ucatty, f);
00563         f << "\n};" << endl;
00564         set<QString> attList;
00565         list<QString> attListLen;
00566         for (k = ucelat.begin(); k != ucelat.end(); ++k) {
00567                 uint size = k->second.size();
00568                 f << "const Attribute MML::" << k->first << "Atts["
00569                         << (size ?size :1) << "] = {" << endl;
00570                 printList("", "", k->second, f);
00571                 f << "\n};" << endl;
00572                 attList.insert(k->first+"Atts");
00573                 attListLen.push_back(QString::number(k->second.size()));
00574         }
00575         f << "const Attribute * const MML::attList[numElements] = {" << endl;
00576         printList("", "", attList, f);
00577         f << "\n};" << endl;
00578         f << "const uint MML::attListLen[numElements] = {" << endl;
00579         printList("", "", attListLen, f);
00580         f << "\n};" << endl;
00581         f << "MMLAttribute * (* const MML::attFunc[numAttTypes])("
00582                 "const DOMString &, Attribute) = {" << endl;
00583         printList("create", "", ucats, f);
00584         f << "\n};" << endl;
00585         f.flush();
00586         file.close();

00589         // attribute that can be modified
00590         file.setFileName("attributes.cpp");
00591         file.open(QFile::WriteOnly  | QFile::Truncate);
00592         f.setDevice(&file);

00595         f << "#define ATTRIBUTES_H" << endl;

00606         f << "\t~Attributes();" << endl;

00608         f << "\tvoid setAttributes(const MMLElement *e);" << endl;
00609         f << "\tvoid unsetAttributes(const MMLElement *e);"
00610                 << endl;
00611         for (l = at.begin(); l != at.end(); ++l) {
00612                 map<QString,QString>::iterator m = custattlist.find(*l);
00613                 QString s = *l;
00614                 if (s == "class") s = "class_";
00615                 s = s.replace(':', '_');
00616                 f << "\tconst " << m->second << " &" << s << "() const;"
00617                         << endl;
00618         }
00619         for (l = atty.begin(); l != atty.end(); ++l) {
00620                 f << "\tvoid setAttribute(MML::Attribute , "
00621                         << "const " << *l << " &);" << endl;
00622         }
00623         f << "\tvoid setAttribute(MML::Attribute, const char*);" << endl;
00624         f << "\tMMLPainter *p;" << endl;

00629         f << "\tstatic const MMLAttribute *defatt[MML::numAttributes];" << endl;
00630         f << "\tAttributeChanges *cur;" << endl;
00631         f << "\tstd::stack<AttributeChanges *> changes;" << endl;
00632         f << "\tPainterSettings *ps;" << endl;

00634         f << "\tvoid restore();" << endl;

00636         f << "\tvoid removeDefaults();" << endl;

00643         file.setFileName("attributes.cpp");
00644         file.open(QFile::WriteOnly  | QFile::Truncate);
00645         f.setDevice(&file);
00646         f << "#include \"attributes.h\"" << endl;
00647         f << "using namespace MML;" << endl;
00648         f << "// this file was automatically generated by 'parseschema'" << endl;
00649         f << "const char *Attributes::defstr[numAttributes] = {"<< endl;
00650         printList("\"", "\"", defat, f);
00651         f << "\n};" << endl;
00652         f << "const MMLAttribute *Attributes::defatt[numAttributes];" << endl;
00653         uint count=0;
00654         for (l = at.begin(); l != at.end(); ++l) {
00655                 map<QString,QString>::iterator m = custattlist.find(*l);
00656                 QString s = *l;
00657                 if (s == "class") s = "class_";
00658                 s = s.replace(':', '_');
00659                 f << "const " << m->second << " &\nAttributes::" << s
00660                         << "() const {\n\treturn static_cast<const MML"
00661                         << m->second
00662                         << "*>(att[" << count++ << "])->value;\n}" << endl;
00663         }
00664 
00665         f << "#include <iostream>" << endl;
00666         f << "using std::endl;" << endl;
00667         f << "using std::cerr;" << endl;
00668         // generate functions for setting the attributes
00669         // DOMString must be treated with care: if the desired type is also
00670         // DOMSting then it can simply set, if not, it is not an error as with
00671         // mismatching types in the other functions, but the DOMString should
00672         // be interpreted as a string argument
00673         for (l = atty.begin(); l != atty.end(); ++l) {
00674                 f << "void" << endl;
00675                 f << "Attributes::setAttribute(MML::Attribute a, const ";
00676                 f << *l << " &value) {" << endl;
00677                 f << "\tconst MMLAttribute *newA;" << endl;
00678                 f << "\tif (attTypes[a] != " << mkvar(*l) << "_T) {\n";
00679                 if (*l == "DOMString") {
00680 
00681                         f << "\t\tAttributeType type = attTypes[a];" << endl;
00682                         f << "\t\tnewA = attFunc[type](value, a);" << endl;
00683                         f << "\t\tif (!newA) {" << endl;
00684                         f << "\t\t\tcerr << \"error in creating attribute  '\""
00685                                 "<<attributeTag[a]<<\"' with value '\" "
00686                                 "<< value.ascii() << \"'\" << endl;" << endl;
00687                         f << "\t\t}" << endl;
00688                 } else {
00689                         f << "\t\tcerr << \"Attribute \" << attributeTag[a]\n";
00690                         f << "\t\t\t<< \" is not of type " << *l << ".\" << endl;\n";
00691                         f << "\t\texit(1);" << endl;
00692                 }
00693                 f << "\t} else {" << endl;
00694                 f << "\t\tnewA = new MML" << *l << "(value);\n";
00695                 f << "\t}" << endl;
00696                 f << "\tcur->add(a, newA, att[a]);" << endl;
00697                 f << "\tatt[a] = newA;" << endl;
00698                 f << "\tif (ps) ps->set(a);" << endl;
00699                 f << "}\n" << endl;
00700         }
00701         f.flush();
00702         file.close();
00703 }
00704 #include <qstringlist.h>
00705 void
00706 readCustAttList() {
00707         QString filepath = dir+"/../custattlist";
00708         QFile file(filepath);
00709         file.open(QFile::ReadOnly);
00710         QTextStream f(&file);
00711         QString line;
00712         while (!f.atEnd()) {
00713                 line = f.readLine();
00714                 QStringList l = line.split('\t');
00715                 QString att, type, def;
00716                 if (l.count() > 0) {
00717                         att = l[0];
00718                         if (l.count() > 1) {
00719                                 type = l[1];
00720                                 if (l.count() > 2) {
00721                                         def = l[2];
00722                                 } else {
00723                                         def = "";
00724                                 }
00725                         } else {
00726                                 type = "";
00727                         }
00728                 } else {
00729                         att = "";
00730                 }
00731                 pair<QString, QString> p(att, type);
00732                 custattlist.insert(p);
00733         }
00734 }
00735 int
00736 main(int argc, char **argv) {
00737         if (argc < 2) {
00738                 printf("specify directory\n");
00739                 return 1;
00740         }
00741         QString adir(argv[1]);
00742         QFileInfo f(adir+"/mathml2/mathml2.xsd");
00743         dir = f.absolutePath();
00744         QDomDocument d = loadDocument(f.filePath());
00745         load(d);
00746         findElements(d);
00747         if (argc == 2) {
00748                 // this is the normal mode of operation
00749                 readCustAttList();
00750                 writeCode();
00751         } else {
00752                 // can't remember what this did
00753                 readCustAttList();
00754                 printAttributes();
00755                 printAttributeTypes();
00756         }
00757 
00758         return 0;
00759 }
